Ortu Gugat SMA Gonzaga karena Anak Tak Naik Kelas, Apa yang Salah?
01 Nov 2019, 09:04 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Pengamat pendidikan Doni Koesoema A mengingatkan soal pendidikan karakter terkait kisruh di SMA Kolese Gonzaga, Jakarta Selatan. Hal itu terkait orang tua yang menggugat Gonzaga sebanyak Rp 551 juta karena anaknya tidak naik kelas.
"Pendidikan karakter sangat penting karena melengkapi dimensi akademis," kata Doni sebagaimana dilansir Antara, Jumat (1/11.2019).
Sebelumnya, ramai diberitakan mengenai orang tua murid SMA Gonzaga menggugat ke pengadilan karena anaknya tidak naik kelas. Di antara yang digugat adalah kepala sekolah dan guru SMA Kolese hingga Dinas Pendidikan DKI Jakarta. Nilai kerugian yang diminta Rp 551 juta.
Doni mengatakan bukan proses pendidikan yang baik jika orientasinya anak pintar tapi tanpa tata krama dan jahat. Dalam proses pendidikan itu, kata dia, tidak hanya soal anak menjadi pintar tetapi memiliki budi pekerti yang baik.
"Karakter terkait penanaman nilai-nilai kebaikan dalam hidup. Maka ini lebih penting daripada sekadar menjadi pintar," katanya.
Atas dasar itu, dia prihatin mengenai gugatan terhadap SMA Kolese Gonzaga lantaran peserta didiknya tinggal kelas karena persoalan akademik dan nonakademik.
Pendidikan karakter, kata Doni, merupakan penilaian dari sisi nonakademik yang saling melengkapi dengan aspek akademik. Penilaian nonakademik sendiri dapat diukur dari standardisasi norma yang diterapkan oleh pihak sekolah.
Sementara itu, Kepala Seksi Peserta Didik dan Pengembangan Karakter Peserta Didik Disdik DKI Jakarta Taga Radja Gah mengatakan siswa SMA Gonzaga bukan hanya karena akademik tapi juga nonakademik terkait karakternya.
"Siswa ini satu mata pelajaran tidak tuntas, yaitu sejarah. Peminatan nilainya 68. KKM-nya 75. Nah kemudian ternyata jauh sebelumnya memang laporannya ada kasus tidak disiplin," katanya.
detikcom sudah mendatangi SMA Gonzaga di Pejaten Barat sejak pagi untuk meminta konfirmasi. Namun pihak sekolah hingga kini belum memberikan pernyataan.

Parent Sues Gonzaga High School because Children Didn't Go Up Class, What's Wrong?
Nov 01 2019, 09:04 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Educational observer Doni Koesoema A reminds about character education related to chaos at Gonzaga College High School, South Jakarta. This is related to parents who sued Gonzaga as much as Rp. 551 million because their children did not go up in class.
"Character education is very important because it complements the academic dimension," Doni said as reported by Antara on Friday (11/11.2019).
Previously, it was widely reported that parents of Gonzaga High School students were suing the court because their children did not go up to class. Among those who were sued were the school principal and teachers of the College of High Schools up to the DKI Jakarta Education Agency. The requested loss value is Rp. 551 million.
Doni said that it was not a good educational process if the orientation of children was smart but without manners and evil. In the process of education, he said, it is not just a matter of children becoming smart but having good character.
"Character related to the inculcation of good values in life. So this is more important than just being smart," he said.
On that basis, he was concerned about the lawsuit against Gonzaga College High School because his students stayed in class because of academic and non-academic issues.
Character education, said Doni, is an assessment from the non-academic side that is complementary to the academic aspects. Non-academic assessment itself can be measured from the standardization of norms applied by the school.
Meanwhile, Head of the Student Section and Character Development of Jakarta Disdik Students in Taga Radja Gah said Gonzaga High School students were not only academic but also non-academic related to their character.
"This student has one subject that is incomplete, that is history. Specialization scores are 68. The KKM is 75. Well then it turns out that long ago there were indeed reports of undisciplined cases," he said.
detikcom has come to Gonzaga High School in West Pejaten since morning to ask for confirmation. But the school has not yet given a statement.
